answers.text:
Leslie - I think the City of Las Vegas' Anniversary was one of the most successful events as a result of a very innovative approach to raising hundreds-of-thousands of dollars by designing a “Las Vegas vehicle license” and received revenue from the Department of Motor Vehicles.  They had a community-wide committee that actually came up with the idea.  Contact Brian Knudsen in the City Manager’s Office at bknudsen@lasvegasnevada.gov for more information.  Brian can put you in touch with the right folks.  
Good luck,  
Pam

author: Leslie Beauregard
text:
The City of Charlottesville has started planning for the City's 250th Anniversary.  City Council will be appointing a citizen/community Steering Commitee but a question has been raised about who or what entity will actually organize and plan events, provide the needed struture to the Steering Commitee, etc.  We are interested in learning about how others have done this - did you outsource or do all in house?  If you had a Steering Commitee, how did you get them to focus and provide some structure?  
Responses can be either posted here or sent directly to Ric Barrick, Director of Communications, at barrick@charlottesville.org.
Thanks for your help!
title: Administration of Municipal Anniversaries
